summary: Déja dup - Backups wants to impose Google-account

description: Makes backups very easy

It's great for desktop users, and works seamlessly with the Gnome Desktop.
Had a problem with this snap a week or so ago, but the developer was responsive and it appears to have fixed the majority of the issues moi had. I'm still waiting for the next 24 hr cycle to see if daily backups run automated. Previously with this snap I had to run them manually as the deja-dup monitor didn't seem to work.

So, fingers crossed for this last bug ... Will update to 5 stars when confirmed.

The version of deja-dup made available through snapcraft can only back up to or restore from Google Drive, which makes it singularly useless. My other computers, that don't use snap packages, can target a wide variety of remote services, but this snap package is so limited in scope that I cannot recommend it at all.
Echoing a previous poster... Destination targets are limited to Google Drive, Microsoft One Drive, network and local drives. I was hoping to back up to an S3 compatible service, but no love.
Doesn't work properly wtih smb, just getting "volume doesn’t implement mount" on steamOS

Perfect app for backing up and restoring using encryption. For some reason some people say it doesn't work for them, I suggest testing it before trusting it. Also it uses duplicity as a backend, so one can use that tool to restore their backups.

Confirming what the previous reviewer wrote, the restore file feature does not seem to work anymore: it always attempts to restore from Google Cloud, regardless of where your backup is actually stored. I reproduced this bug in both Fedora 27 and Ubuntu 17.10. A backup utility that cannot restore files is more dangerous than useful, so one star from me.

I was eventually able to restore my files by installing Ubuntu 16.04.
Simple GUI, encrypted backups, perfect.

It's an easy to understand GUI to the powerful rsync. Simplicity and reliability is what one wants in a backup application, and for a desktop or series of desktops in a SOHO type of environment, this is perfect.
Perfect! Simple GUI, easy to understand, very useful.
The configuration is easy. It uses your PGP key for file encryption.

It will work only for very small amount of data, as it takes a lot of time to prepare the diff backup files and encrypt them.
You also won't be able to access to individual files and restore them. It is all or nothing. It also does not have many options, and is quite restricted in terms of period rotation. I prefer a simpler solution based on rsync.
Easy, simple, lots of options - and it works.  Now I can forget about rsync and all the extra stuff to make it do what I want.
This is not good program. Not backup my files.

There was a time when deja dup would not be capable of restoring the files it backed up on xcfe(bug), because of that I went to backintime instead. Nowadays I think it is good. The backups do take a lot of time the first time, later they take less time. It has backup frequency, specific folder selection, and in the distro I used it had integration with the file manager via right click on file and revert option. But if you want to restore a folder which no longer exists, you will have to create a folder with the same name and ask to revert to a previous version (may lead to file loss if your memory is short).
summary: Had problems before, now I like it

description: Very simple and works for those with simple setups. Notifications are now working better which is great. Need deja-dup-nautilus extension to restore individual files.

There is another review giving 2 stars and advocating for rsync instead, which may illustrate a difficulty some people have in understanding how backup work (relative to "making a copy with rsync").

This app has the ability to A) encrypt your files B) make a diff backup. It also works as any backup work, by serialising individual files into a longer stream of data (this optimises both disk usage on the target backup drive and the efficiency of compression). All of these features (which guarantee both the possibility to go back in time and to have your files "safe and sound" even when uploaded offsite) comes at the price of some processing overhead, but this is why backups are normally scheduled for times at which the computer is not being used intensively.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description: It will back files up, but will not restore them.
Don't download

They had a slight hiccup for a couple weeks (distro didn't matter) where it wouldn't backup automatically (manual still worked) but they fixed that.

Otherwise, I've used it for some time on Ubuntu and now on Fedora. It does what I need it to, backup files daily, and has a great success rate that I'm not worried.

As with ALL backup systems, you should always test backup and restore immediately then again after a week then again after a bunch of months to make sure its working well and stays working well.

Alternatively and better still you can run two backup applications/systems in case something goes wrong with one.

I've been using this off and on for my desktop and laptop backups but this is really the last time. Getting rid of it now. It simply cannot be relied upon as a backup solution unfortunately.
The user experience issues aside (try getting logging information to work, the DEJA_DUP_DEBUG=1 setting doesn't work for me), I've done restores at least 6 separate occasions and have had 3 failures to restore. Backup is thus completely lost. Dejadup is busy restoring and after an hour comes with "restore failed, hashes don't match" or something like that. Basically, a corrupted backup. I've had no issues when doing the actual backup, shouldn't it check if my backup is corrupted? If I did a backup and everything looks fine I trust that it is fine. If I then do a restore and get "oops, your backup is corrupt, sorry" it really is a big problem.
I've restored from secondary harddisks and FTP on the local wireless network. Both types had failures, FTP more so.

I'll simply have to do manual backups from now on, hoping that will be more reliable.
Went back to rsync. Simple and clean.

It does actually backup and restore, but the interface seems a little broken. If you're trying to use it, make sure you set you backup folder (this includes if you are trying to restore backups) before clicking backup or restore. It doesn't seem to listen to where you tell it after you've started the process. They really should fix that.

Confirming what previous reviewers are saying. I'm on Fedora 28.
I want to restore a backup I did, and I select the folder I want to restore from.
However, after you move forward in the forms, before clicking the final restore button, the folder from which you restore comes back to be a different one (some sort of default one). It's the last folder I backed up to (could confirm because of different paasphrase, and I remember which is which).
Long story short... I need to restore a backup and I'm not able to. Great.
I'll try downgrading the package to a previous version, maybe it works.
summary: Cannot restore files from locations different from the default one

Just saying...

I had a complete system crash a week ago that required a re-install. My backup was only documents folders and desktop, but after the restore from backup I found that it also gave my Thunderbird calendar back.

That was a big bonus. It certainly worked for me.

Not only could I not recover my files when I moved to 19.04 because duplicity is not installed but I could not recover them with a fresh install of 18.04! It wont work on either distro seemingly because duplicity is not actually installed and cannot be install by any means that I possess. So all my work is gone. Not because I failed to back it up but because I trusted the backups I had made.

I was able to perform the initial backup with this tool and set the schedule to do a backup once a week. I always do a manual backup just before I make any significant changes. However, the software ignored my setting and tried to do a backup 12 hours later. It failed and the error was not helpful, "Failed to create backup", with no additional details. Worse yet, when I clicked OK on the notification it immediately attempted to create a backup again without asking if I would like it to perform the action right then. Again it failed and up popped the error. Repeat closing the error notice, it failing, and error popping up ad infinitum. 
I turned off auto-update and tried to do a backup manually, it failed to.
This app has now been removed.

description: I backed up my data for quite some time using this app ... or so I thought. Just before upgrading my distro I did one last back up, but when I went to transfer my files, I found out that no backups had been made for 9 months. This is beyond disappointing! I guess I had been plugging in my back up volume for no reason all this time. This app needs **way** more informative notifications ... and should probably present a progress bar when it is actually performing a backup.

The app does not always perform backups. Occasionally, you are forced to modify settings, dive into logs, deduce error messages, and re-certify your credentials with a login. This is an annoying headache. Still, it IS easy to use and setup.

description: All my files are backed up, but I can't restore them with this tool. I have to do it manually, and even then I can't get all my files back because many of them are split up into many files that won't go back together easily.
Back up button stayed dull and I could not get it to start.

Been using Deja Dup for a couple of years. It performs flawlessly with minimum fuss. Makes backups right on schedule or and starts backups immediately if your machine was turned off at the scheduled time. 

It's hands-down the easiest backup solution I've used to date. And it makes a back-up of the most important files (your home directory) by default. Allowing even novices to just install it, set a backup location and schedule and leave it to do the rest automatically.

I've done a number of restores and they work well. Have never had data loss as a result of Deja Dup backups. Instead there is usually lots of versions to choose from. You have to restore the whole backup set from a point in time when you restore. But you can do restore to a different directory and choose the files you need.

All in all it is so easy to use there is really no excuse not to have backups.
summary: Backup so easy anyone can do it. Love it!

description: Removed it using software center and re-install. Bingo it works now.
Works just fine with a autofs-mounted smb share.

So far backing up works. I haven't tried restoring, but I hope that would work too. Only problem is with locked files in my profile like .mysql_history which throws error every backup and there is nothing I can do about it really.
Very simple to use, and the feature set is solid.

Some clever software engineer wrote that error message, but it means nothing to me. Website says to use -
pip something or other. not understood on command line so that's no good.
I sort of expected that installing the program would install backend, frontends, apiclients and all the rest so that it might actually do what it is supposed to. Or a helpful and understandable error message might be generated that let me know what I must do to sort it out. Telling me to read "manpage" whatever that is, and not telling me where i might find this "manpage" which holds all the secrets was pretty spectacularly unhelpful. Did no-one think of this before? Gobbles huge space in Google Drive,soon floods the drive with backups. Default six months hold before deletion of backups is far too long.

I try to backup to secondary drive and I get "deja vu this storage location is no longer available"

Google no help.

I had a disk full error and managed to write out a file with 0 bytes instead of the weeks of work it actually was. So my file was gone... 

Luckily there was my backup! But inconveniently this took hours because I had to dump the entire backup to a folder to get my one 86k file. there is NO WAY to restore a single file! You must restore the entire backup to get your one file! 

May I please request that a feature is added to be able to restore single files? Commercial backup software often has this, so why not deja-dup?

This is a toy for small backups. When larger backup fails for any reason, DejaDup deletes already uploaded files and starts from scratch. There are lots of other issues with larger backups. Don't use it for cloud backups larger than about 10GB.

description:
I love its simplicity and it really works as advertised. It can be a truly setup and forget kinda deal! Tested on both Ubuntu and Fedora with the data stored on a NAS drive in my LAN with good results.
That said, Deja-Dup can be quite slow if you have thousands of small files backed up. Even restoring a few kbytes file can take up to several minutes, presumably because duplicity needs to go through the entire archive - split in hundreds of oddly-sized 25 Mb chunks with no visible way to change it - before doing anything and thus if speed is a concern, you should definitely look elsewhere.
And in true GNOME fashion, where removing features is seen as a "good thing", the developer inexplicably removed the --restore-missing feature on version 42.0 and up (in favor of a badly designed file browser) which is what broke Nautilus, Caja and Dolphin extensions everywhere so I've been forced to downgrade and pin the package to version 40 on Fedora as I consider that its killer feature and can't conceive how someone thought that removing it would be desirable...
summary: Love and hate it at the same time

description: Simple and easy to use!
Seemed to broken perpetually in Ubuntu, (personal experience) but has always been rock solid for me on GNU/Linux Debian.

I'm using Deja-Dup to back-up my Home directory and personal files. 
Works very well and is tremendously practical. 

As explained above, this application is not for a full system (root) back-up. There are other back-up applications for that, that will give you restore points on your system. As those applications are not for personal back-ups, I use Dejau-Dup with one of those applications to get a full, sustainable system back-up.

Wärend die Einbindung auf dem Desktop absolut grandios ist hatte ich immer wieder unverständliche Fehlermeldungen oder fehlgeschlagene Backups und dadurch eine gewisse Unsicherheit.

description:
Es sollte möglichst nicht nur das Sichern funktioniern, sondern auch die Wiederherstellung:
Gesichert wurde nur das home-Verzeichnis mit den Mails (.thunderbird) die Wiederherstellung scheitert aber.
1. Versuch: Fehlende Schreibrechte im Zielverzeichnis (home)! Außerdem Warnung wegen zu wenig Speicherplatz (40GB sind aber frei!!)

2. Versuch: Wiederherstellung auf externe USB-Platte. Wieder fehlende Schreibrechte im Zielverzeichnis!!!

3. Versuch: Wiederherstellung mit root-Rechten (sudo) und Zielverzeichnis auf externer USB-Platte. Abbruch wegen zu wenig Speicherplatz (1,2TB sind aber frei!!)
Benutze DejaDup schon set Jahren unter Debian,und kann nur bestätigen,das es das beste Datensicherungswerkzeug ist.
Auf dieses Backup-Tool kann man sich im Ernstfall leider nicht verlassen. Fehlermeldungen ohne Erklärung werden angezeigt. Alternative: "Timeshift"

Es passt sich wunderbar zur GNOME-Shell und die Nautilus-Funktion finde ich auch super!
Aber es ist nicht nur etwas für GNOME-Benutzer, sondern auch für Leute die die Oberfläche aufgeräumt und modern haben wollen.

X mal komplett Home gesichert und X mal vollständig zurückgesichert. Funktioniert einwandfrei. Bei der richtigen Einstellung tägliche Sicherung möglich. Bestes Back Up Programm zumindest unter Gnome.

Ich habe versucht, damit ein Backup meiner Linux-Daten auf einer externen NTFS-Platte zu schreiben. Das tägliche Backup funktionierte wenn es hochkommt vier-, fünfmal. Dann gab es (bis zur Neueinrichtung) nur noch Fehlermeldungen.
In einem Fall wurde die Partition des Backup-Laufwerks beschädigt, so dass diese neu partitioniert werden musste (was das Schreiben eines Komplett-Backups meiner Windows-Daten bedeutet hat).
Also wenn man von Windows kommt, dann stellt man sich unter einer Backup-Lösung etwas anderes vor...

Hier wäre es Wünschenswert, wenn das Backup dennoch fortfährt und in einem Log festhält, welche Daten nicht wiederhergestellt werden können. 

Einzige brauchbare Funktion: Mit Nautilus Integration einzelne Dateien wiederherstellen. Dafür gibt's einen Stern.

description: It's almost perfect, I don't know any tool which can be configured to backup files to an SMB share this easy. I wish it had multiple profiles for different backup jobs, so i still need a second backup app for other backups on differens USB-HDDs. But otherwise I enjoy Deja-Dup and use it for years.

funciona perfecto

En la última actualización la 42.8 en los respaldos automáticos salen mensajes de fallo: Another duplicity instance is already running with this archive directory. En las versiones anteriores todo perfecto. Creo que es un bug -> Equipo de desarrollo corregir esto.
summary: Mensajes de fallo en los respaldos automáticos

description: podes cifrar tus datos en la nube, o en un usb o donde se te cante el orto, lo uso para hacer back ups semanalmente, solo le das a instalar y ya, si es dificil hacer eso, volve a windows :P
Llega a parecer bloatware habiendo aplicaciones tan buenas como Timeshift. Es útil, pero le falta mucho para que le llegue a confiar la recuperación de mi sistema en un mal día.
Funciona perfecto y hace lo que dice, probado sobre fedora 36 gnome 42.2.
es mi app favorita y facil de usar !!
summary: es mi app favorita y facil de usar !!

description:
Système de backup incrémental ne fonctionne pas.
Gestion malheureuse de NTFS.
Good program but version 36.* is buggy
summary: Good program but version 36.* is buggy

description: Pas facile à utiliser. Impossible de changer le mot de passe!

Contrairement à Paul, je la trouve très simple et facile à utiliser.
Je l'utilise depuis de nombreuses années.
traie bon système facile a utilise ?️

Difficile de faire plus simple. Je n'ai encore jamais été obligé de faire une récupération , mais si c'est aussi simple que de sauvegarder , il n'y aura pas de difficultés. Merci à ceux qui ont mis en place cette application gratuite.
je viens de l'utiliser pour récupérer un fichier effacer par erreur, ça a marché. Bon, il a fallu que je cherche comment faire sur le site web car ce n'est pas intuitif

On dit quels dossiers sauvegarder.
Pour l'emplacement de stockage, il propose Google-Drive que j'ai déjà.
C'est donc particulièrement simple.
J'ai testé la sauvegarde d'un dossier, puis sa restauration : aucun problème.
summary: application simple et efficace, je recommande

description:
Une excellente application qui vaut vraiment le détour, permettant de cloner de conserver et de restaurer les données d'un PC Ubuntu de manière simple et pratique sans se prendre la tête !
Il faudrait juste penser à préinstaller le module PyDrive car certaines personnes qui ne comprendraient pas ne pourraient pas faire le rapprochement avec Python, qui n'est absolument pas utilisé dans l'application originale Deja Dup (que je vous déconseille d'utiliser car elle n'est pas isolée)....
Pour les personnes qui se sont retrouvées dans cette galère et qui aimeraient en sortir, voici la commande à copier-coller dans un terminal administrateur pour installer le module manquant :
"pip3 install pydrive"
(pensez à installer le module pip3 s'il n'est pas déjà installé... "apt-get install pip3")
Ce logiciel est génial!!
Super logiciel pour faire des sauveagrdes facilement.
Bravo les champions du logiciel libre ...
summary: MDR 1ere fois que j'utilise ubuntu et il me damnde mon compte Google

description: rien a dire fait le job !
les dosiers ne se suppriment pas automatiquement, ce qui entraîne un remplissage rapide du disque dur.

Une catastrophe ! Vous passez des heures et des heures à essayer de récupérer vos datas cryptées pour finalement n'en retrouver qu'un quart … Mieux vaut tout simplement sauvegarder l'essentiel par transfert de dossier (sans app)
J'utilise cette app pour sauvegarde sur ssd externe, et pour stockage sur disque réseaux, fonctionne très bien.
fluide et simple pour des sauvegardes régulières

Risque de perte des données par restauration impossible dans certains cas.
Cette application est dangereuse car la sauvegarde se passe bien et on croit que nos données sont protégées. Quand j'ai testé la restauration au bout d'un an d'utilisation, seule celle du SSD a été restituée, celle du disque ne s'est pas faite (j'avais sauvegardé mes données courantes qui sont sur une partie de mon SSD, et mes archives sur une partie du disque dur). Donc faire des essais pour tester ce que cette application sait faire, et ce qu'elle ne fait pas. Et mes essais en ligne de commande de duplicity on indiqué des erreurs sans que je trouve la parade.
summary: Danger : la restauration ne fonctionne pas toujours

description:
Куда то делась коробочная поддержка Яндекса. Пишет не поддерживает https, хотя весь интернет забит советами использовать именно его. Пришлось в кривую - ставить демона YandexDisk и потом туда делать бекап. 
С таким же успехом я могу сделать что то типа 
rsync через tar... 
Через месяц поглядим, как он восстанавливает...
Пока впечатление не очень.

При работе с Google аккаунтом работает через пень колоду, запускается с ошибками, кнопка Восстановление вообще не активна.
Абсолютно бестолковая

It makes really complex things simple and scheduled!

Deja-Dup is my favourite simple backup frontend for everyone. Using really powerfull console utulity it makes my data simply protected.
summary: It's a really userfriendly backup utility

description: Хорошо, удобно, добротно!

Этим приложением создала резервную копию всего жесткого диска. Длилась эта процедура три часа. Решила восстановить из этой резервной копии всю систему. Но не восстановились мои настройки самой системы, также не восстановились установленные мной программы и не восстановились ярлыки программ. Восстановились только отдельные файлы, которые я же сама создала. Для чего вообще нужно это приложение?
summary: Это приложение не все файлы восстанавливает

description: тока аккуратно откат, может пути напутать

чтобы backup шел в облако, придется использовать диск яндекс, google drive работает криво. 
в автозапуск при старте 

#!/bin/bash
rm -drf ~/Yandex.Disk/backup-folder/*
(sleep 300 ; deja-dup --backup)
summary: Удобно, но нужно не много доработать

description: Стабильно, удобно, понятно, надёжно.
шняга еще та, для любителей
quick and simple too for regular backup
闪退，没法备份。欸可惜了，以前可是自带应用呢
After my restoration, it said unknown error, so all my files are gone!
